definitions.definition: Possessing beauty , impressing the eye ; attractive .
examples: Anyone who has ever met her thought she was absolutely beautiful .
There's a beautiful lake by the town.

subdefinitions.definition: Used emphatically or ironically, after the noun it qualifies.

examples: He was a beautiful person; he would drop everything to help you.
You've done a beautiful thing today.

definitions.definition: Affording pleasure to any of the senses , especially that of hearing ; delightful .
examples: It's beautiful outside, let's go for a walk.
These carnations smell beautiful but those daffodils smell funny.

definitions.definition: Impressing with charm in an intellectual or moral way, through inherent suitability or elegance .
examples: The skater performed a beautiful axel .

main_definition: Possessing beauty , impressing the eye ; attractive . [from 1520s]
secondary_definitions: Affording pleasure to any of the senses , especially that of hearing ; delightful . [from 1860s]
Impressing with charm in an intellectual or moral way, through inherent suitability or elegance . [from 1580s]
